common_issues.title: Long Term Memory feature causes high CPU usage
common_issues.description: Users report slowdowns and high CPU usage when Long Term Memory (LTM) is enabled in Pieces OS. The issue persists across Windows and macOS, potentially linked to specific applications like Slack, Discord, and Microsoft Edge. Proposed solutions include updating Edge and WebView2 Runtimes, reducing open tabs, and adjusting file locations. The Pieces team is actively investigating and working on fixes.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: High CPU Usage with LTM2

**Key Points Raised:**

* LTM2 feature causes high CPU usage on some systems, particularly with Microsoft Edge and certain configurations.
* Issue persists across macOS and Windows.
* Potential correlation between CPU usage and number of open tabs in Edge.

**Problems Identified:**

* High CPU usage impacting performance and responsiveness.
* Inconsistent behavior, with some users experiencing significant improvements after updating Microsoft Edge and WebView2 Runtimes.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Investigating CPU usage on macOS/Windows in relation to LTM2.
* Patches released for Pieces OS 11.2.2, with further fixes planned for the following week.
* Users explored temporary workarounds involving reduced number of open tabs and adjusting file locations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue partially resolved for some users with updated Edge and WebView2 Runtimes.
* Root cause still under investigation.
* Further fixes are expected in the upcoming week.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of collaborative troubleshooting within the user community.
* Ongoing communication and updates are provided by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on Pieces OS Memory Usage

### Key Points Raised:

* High RAM and CPU usage by Pieces OS, causing slowdowns and impacting system performance.
* Memory usage reported to be around 2GB or more, even with no models running.
* CPU usage spikes reported to be as high as 100% on some machines.
* Suspected memory leak in some cases, with RAM usage increasing continuously.

### Problems Identified:

* High resource consumption impacting user experience and system performance.
* Potential memory leak leading to unnecessary RAM usage.
* Lack of control over resource usage, particularly CPU spikes.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Replacing heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0 to improve memory and CPU usage.
* Active development of additional fixes to further optimize resource consumption.
* "Optimize Memory" feature to unload ML models and free up RAM.
* Setting pieces to only use E-cores to manage CPU usage and temperature.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 released with improvements to memory and CPU usage.
* Mixed reports from users: some have seen significant improvement, while others still experience high resource usage.
* Issue remains open and under investigation by the Pieces team.

### Key Takeaways:

* PiecesOS team is aware of the resource consumption issues and actively working on solutions.
* Recent updates may have improved the situation for some users, but further optimization is needed.
* Users experiencing high resource usage are encouraged to report the issue and provide feedback.

related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

11.0.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## GitHub Issue Summary: Ollama Installation Failure

**Key Points:**

* Ollama installation fails for Pieces users with snap installations.
* This is due to curl not being available in the snap sandbox environment.
* The issue persists as of March 3, 2025.

**Problems Identified:**

* The required `curl` program is missing in the Pieces snap environment, preventing Ollama installation.
* The issue affects both downloading and inference of local LLM models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Adding curl to the Pieces snap dependency list.
* Modifying Pieces to allow Ollama usage from within the sandbox.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A fix is in development and expected to be released soon.
* Users are advised to wait for the update or consider switching to a non-snap installation.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users are frustrated by the delay in resolving the issue.
* Some users are concerned about privacy implications of using cloud-based LLMs.

User @AkhilTrivediX experienced an error when trying to use a Cloud-based LLM in Pieces while in Local-only mode.

* The user needs to use a Local LLM instead of a Cloud-based LLM when in Local-only mode.

**Solutions:**
* Download and use a Local LLM.
* Select the "On-Device" option in the menu to view Local LLM options.
* Experiment with different Local LLMs to find one that best suits your needs.
